Dear Sheffield City Council,
This is a request for all the information I am entitled to under the Freedom of Information Act. If this request is too wide or unclear, please contact me in the first instance as under section 16 of the Act, public authorities are required to advise and assist requesters. If the requested information cannot be provided within the time and cost limit for all the years specified, please narrow this down to fewer years.
1. For each of the last 10 financial years,
a) How many full-time officers were allocated to support the council’s scrutiny committees and other scrutiny functions?
b) Please provide a breakdown of all the formal scrutiny committees and other scrutiny functions, i.e. task and finish groups, that the officers were allocated to.
2. In each of the years, how many FTE hours were dedicated to supporting the scrutiny process by other officers as required? ie providing legal advice or attending meetings to present reports or answer questions.
I understand I should receive a response within 20 working days.
Yours faithfully,
Don Mort
On behalf of Research for Action

Dear Don Mort,
Thank you for your request for information relating to Scrutiny which we
received on 26/09/2023.
This has been logged as a Freedom of Information Request and will be dealt
with under the Freedom of Information Act 2000. The reference number for
your request can be found above.
The Freedom of Information Act 2000 states that we must respond to you
within 20 working days, by 24/10/2023. Please do not hesitate to contact
us at the email address below if you have any queries.
Yours sincerely,
Sheffield City Council
PO Box 1283
Sheffield, S1 1UJ

Dear Don Mort
Thank you for your four requests for information regarding Audit
Committees, which you sent us in separate emails on 26 September 2023. We
have combined them for ease of administrative processing.
First request
CIPFA Guidance on Local Authority Audit Committees states that
“Recommended practice is for audit committees to review and assess
themselves annually or to seek an external review.”
a) Internal Annual Review of Audit Committee For each of the last five
financial years please provide me with a copy of the audit committee’s
annual review of its work. Please state the date the review was published
and how it was made public at the time.
Annually the Audit and Standards Committee conduct a review of its work
and the links are below. The reports are in the public domain and
published on SCC website as part of the Audit and Standards Committee
Agenda items. The dates quoted below are the dates of the A&SC meeting and
papers are published 7 days prior to the meeting date.
22^nd June 2023
[1]
https://democracy.sheffield.gov.uk/docum...
24^th March 2022
[2]
https://democracy.sheffield.gov.uk/docum...
22^nd April 2021
[3]
https://democracy.sheffield.gov.uk/docum...
18^th April 2019
[4]
https://democracy.sheffield.gov.uk/docum...
April 2020 Audit and Standards Committee was cancelled due to the Covid
pandemic.
b) External Review of Audit Committee
Please confirm the most recent date that an external review of the audit
committee was sought, who undertook that review, when and where it was
published and provide a copy of the review.
No information held.
Second request
1. For each of the last 10 financial years,
a) How many full-time officers were allocated to support the council’s
scrutiny committees and other scrutiny functions?
Many of our officers are full-time, and many supported the scrutiny
function. These were drawn from policy, democratic and legal services. We
have not kept count. However, all the officers who were involved are
listed on the reports of the committee which you can find going back to
2013 on our website here: [5]Committee structure | Sheffield City Council
As this information is accessible to you, it is exempt under Section 21.
b) Please provide a breakdown of all the formal scrutiny committees and
other scrutiny functions, i.e. task and finish groups, that the officers
were allocated to.
Please look at our agendas for the Audit Committee (2013-2016) via the
advanced search function and the Audit and Standards Committee
(2016-present) here: [6]Committee structure | Sheffield City Council (and
see the exemption in (a))
2. In each of the years, how many FTE hours were dedicated to supporting
the scrutiny process by other officers as required? ie providing legal
advice or attending meetings to present reports or answer questions.
We do not record this information.
Third request
The independence of scrutiny committees and audit committees has been
identified in a number of Public Interest Reports as being an important
factor in facilitating meaningful scrutiny and challenge within local
authorities.
As audit committees are not formally treated as part of scrutiny it may be
that they are treated differently in the council’s constitution and
policies. Please clarify which committee type your response relates to.
a) Policy on Selection & Appointment of Committee Chairs
Please provide the council’s current policy on selection and appointment
of scrutiny committee chairs and audit committee chairs.
Our committee is an audit and standards committee. This is covered in our
constitution:
[7]
https://democracy.sheffield.gov.uk/ieLis...
(and see the exemption in the response to your second request (1)(a))
b) Current Political Configuration of Committee Chairs Please provide a
figure showing what percentage of current scrutiny and audit committee
chairs are members of an opposition party to the main controlling party or
controlling coalition.
There is no overall control of the city council. You can see the make-up
of the committee here:
[8]Contact details - Audit and Standards Committee | Sheffield City
Council
You can see the political party membership here: [9]Your Councillors |
Sheffield City Council
(and see the exemption in the response to your second request (1)(a))
Fourth request
1. For each of the last ten financial years, please provide original
copies of all formal requests for a call in of key decisions by the
council.
2. Please state whether the call-in request was accepted/deemed valid. If
it was not accepted, please state the reasons why not.
3. For each call-in please state whether the key decision had gone ahead
at the date of this request.
Please only answer the first question if all three would exceed the time
and cost limit.
All decisions are listed here: [10]Decisions, 11 October 2023 - 25 October
2023, | Sheffield City Council
(and see the exemption in the response to your second request (1)(a))
Otherwise, it would exceed the appropriate limit (the “cost” limit) of 18
hours of officer time to search our records, electronic and manual, for
original copies of all formal requests. Ten years is a considerable period
of time; there has been a churn of officers and systems, and the locating,
retrieving and extracting this information would exceed the cost of
compliance. We believe we have undertaken our duty to advise and assist
you under section 16 of the FOIA by providing our electronic register of
decisions.
If you have any queries about this response, please do not hesitate to
contact us.
The information provided in this response is available for re-use under
the terms of the Open Government Licence v3.0. The terms of the OGL can be
found [11]here. When re-using the information, Sheffield City Council
requires you to include the following attribution statement: “Contains
public sector information obtained from Sheffield City Council and
licensed under the Open Government Licence v3.0.”
If you are unhappy with the response you have received in relation to your
request, you are entitled to have this reviewed. You can ask for an
internal review by replying to this email. Internal review requests should
be submitted within 40 working days from the date of this response.
If you remain dissatisfied with the outcome of your internal review, you
can contact the Information Commissioner’s Office. Please see
[12]
https://ico.org.uk/make-a-complaint/offi...
for further details.
Kind Regards,
Sheffield City Council
PO Box 1283
Sheffield, S1 1UJ
